parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Neuter Singular
str2: Who, which, what, why. Probably emphatic of tis; an interrogative pronoun, who, which or what.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Easier. Comparative of a compound of eu and kopos; better for toil, i.e. More facile.
Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Singular
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Plural
str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.
Or, than. A primary particle of distinction between two connected terms; disjunctive, or; comparative, than.
Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: (a) I wake, arouse, (b) I raise up. Probably akin to the base of agora; to waken, i.e. Rouse.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Singular
str2: From peri and pateo; to tread all around, i.e. Walk at large; figuratively, to live, deport oneself, follow.
